Token.Abstract: The Vantiq class declares the interface for authentication and subsequent interaction with a Vantiq server.
Access token to be used for direct Vantiq server operations.
Access token to be used for direct Vantiq server operations.
Access token to be used for direct Vantiq server operations.
Constructor for use with all other Vantiq server operations.

Parameter.Name: version
Parameter.Abstract: Version of the Vantiq API to use

Token.Abstract: Constructor for use with all other Vantiq server operations. This constructor will use the most recent version of the Vantiq API. If an earlier version of the API is required, use the initWithServer:server apiVersion:version contructor.
The authenticate method connects to the Vantiq server with the given authentication credentials used to authorize the user. The username and password credentials are not stored.

Parameter.Name: username
Parameter.Abstract: The username to provide access to the Vantiq server

Parameter.Name: password
Parameter.Abstract: The password associated with the username

ReturnValue.Abstract: response: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The select method issues a query to select all matching records for a given type. The select may query both user-defined types as well as system types, such as procedures and types.
Token.Declaration: - (void)select:(NSString *)type props:(NSArray *)props where:(NSString *)where sort:(NSString *)sort completionHandler:(void ( ^ ) ( NSArray *data , NSHTTPURLResponse *response , NSError *error ))handler

Parameter.Name: props
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the desired properties to be returned in each record. An empty array or null value means all properties will be returned. The array contains NSStrings.

Parameter.Name: where
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies constraints to filter the data. Null means all records will be returned.

Parameter.Name: sort
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the desired sort for the result set. This is a JSON-formatted string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: array of NSDictionary objects of matching recordsresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The select method issues a query to select all matching records for a given type. The select may query both user-defined types as well as system types, such as procedures and types.
Token.Declaration: - (void)select:(NSString *)type props:(NSArray *)props where:(NSString *)where completionHandler:(void ( ^ ) ( NSArray *data , NSHTTPURLResponse *response , NSError *error ))handler

Parameter.Name: props
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the desired properties to be returned in each record. An empty array or null value means all properties will be returned. The array contains NSStrings.

Parameter.Name: where
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies constraints to filter the data. Null means all records will be returned. This is a JSON-formatted string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: array of NSDictionary objects of matching recordsresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The select method issues a query to select all matching records for a given type. The select may query both user-defined types as well as system types, such as procedures and types.

Parameter.Name: props
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the desired properties to be returned in each record. An empty array or null value means all properties will be returned. The array contains NSStrings.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: array of NSDictionary objects of matching recordsresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The select method issues a query to select all matching records for a given type. The select may query both user-defined types as well as system types, such as procedures and types.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: array of NSDictionary objects of matching recordsresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The selectOne method issues a query to select a single record for a given type and unique identifier.

Parameter.Name: ID
Parameter.Abstract: The unique identifier that matches the type's '_id' property.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: array of NSDictionary objects of matching recordsresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The count method is similar to the select method except it returns only the number of records rather than returning the records themselves.
Token.Declaration: - (void)count:(NSString *)type where:(NSString *)where completionHandler:(void ( ^ ) ( int count , NSHTTPURLResponse *response , NSError *error ))handler

Parameter.Name: where
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies constraints to filter the data. Null means all records will be returned. This is a JSON-formatted string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: count: number of matching recordsresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The count method is similar to the select method except it returns only the number of records rather than returning the records themselves.

ReturnValue.Abstract: count: number of matching recordsresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The insert method creates a new record of a given type.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The JSON-formated string data to insert.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: copy of the inserted dataresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The update method updates an existing record of a given type. This method supports partial updates meaning that only the properties provided are updated. Any properties not specified are not changed in the underlying record.
Token.Declaration: - (void)update:(NSString *)type id:(NSString *)ID object:(NSString *)object completionHandler:(void ( ^ ) ( NSDictionary *data , NSHTTPURLResponse *response , NSError *error ))handler

Parameter.Name: ID
Parameter.Abstract: The "_id" internal identifier for the record.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The JSON-formated string data to update.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: copy of the updated dataresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The upsert method either creates or updates a record in the database depending if the record already exists. The method tests for existence by looking at the natural keys defined on the type.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The JSON-formated string data to upsert.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: copy of the upserted dataresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The delete method removes records from the system for a given type. Deletes always require a constraint indicating which records to remove.

Parameter.Name: where
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies constraints to filter the data. This is a JSON-formatted string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: response: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The deleteOne method issues a query to delete a single record for a given type and unique identifier.

Parameter.Name: ID
Parameter.Abstract: The unique identifier that matches the type's '_id' property.

ReturnValue.Abstract: response: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The publish method publishes a message onto a given topic. Messages published onto topics can trigger rules to facilitate identifying situations.

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The topic on which to publish.

Parameter.Name: message
Parameter.Abstract: The message to publish. This is a JSON-formatted string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: response: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The execute method executes a procedure on the Vantiq server. Procedures can take parameters (i.e. arguments) and produce a result.

Parameter.Name: procedure
Parameter.Abstract: The procedure to execute. The parameters may be provided as an array where the arguments are given in order. Alternatively, the parameters may be provided as an object where the arguments are named.

Parameter.Name: params
Parameter.Abstract: Parameters passed to the procedure. This is a JSON-formatted string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: result of method execution, if anyresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response

Token.Abstract: The execute method executes a procedure on the Vantiq server. Procedures can take parameters (i.e. arguments) and produce a result.

Parameter.Name: procedure
Parameter.Abstract: The procedure to execute. The parameters may be provided as an array where the arguments are given in order. Alternatively, the parameters may be provided as an object where the arguments are named.

ReturnValue.Abstract: data: result of method execution, if anyresponse: iOS HTTP operation responseerror: iOS error condition response
